description: Users may experience unexpected behavior when attempting to execute certain files or commands. In particular, they need to interact with potentially malicious folders or directories, which could lead to remote code execution if they inadvertently execute harmful files. This issue is most relevant for systems running Windows 10 and Windows 11 (various build numbers as indicated), stemming from CVE-2024-43581. Users must take caution as this vulnerability exploits specific user actions, potentially leading to unauthorized access or control over the affected systems. Reports indicate that this could affect all systems running the impacted builds, specifically highlighting KB articles such as KB-5044284 and KB-5044285 for remediation guidance.
